thread.title: Lisa Marie Presley and Michael Lockwood in court today
thread.title_full: Lisa Marie Presley and Michael Lockwood in court today

title: Lisa Marie Presley and Michael Lockwood in court today
text: show ad EXCLUSIVE: 'Get a job!' Lisa Marie Presley lashes out at 'freeloader' Michael Lockwood and she leaves court smiling as LA judge denies his demand for $40,000 a month in spousal support Today, Lisa Marie - dressed in a stylish black pantsuit, white shirt and boots - showed up at Los Angeles Superior Court to challenge Lockwood's demand for her to pay him $40,000 a month in spousal support He was also demanding $100,000 in attorney fees 'He could be a car salesman. He could be a music teacher. But he doesn't seem to think he has an obligation to earn money,' Lisa Marie's lawyer told the judge The fight for custody of their 8-year-old twins will not be heard until next month Lisa Marie said in court documents that the twins were taken by Child Family Protective Services - they are currently in the care of grandmother Priscilla Presley Lisa Marie claims she found hundreds of disturbing pictures and video footage of children on Lockwood's computer The battle became increasingly messy over the weekend, as Lockwood claims Presley broke court rules by alleging that he is being investigated over the improper pictures of children, found on his computer He said there are also bombshell allegations against her While she's crying poverty, Lockwood claimed she still receives $466,000 a month — $5.6 million a year — from the trust Elvis set up for his only child Published: 18:28 GMT, 22 February 2017 | Updated: 20:11 GMT, 22 February 2017 5 shares
